msItem.title: 'Aja'ib al-Makhluqat wa Ghara'ib al-Maujudat.
msItem.note: Title page, on top of paper overlays: a) 'Edwd. Galley' next to impression of small oval seal with Edward Galley in Arabic script. b) In pencil: D Price -- Purchd -- 20th Sept 1804. c) In ink: Purchased from Mr Galleys manuscripts on the 20th Septbr 1804 by David Price d) Notice of ownership in Arabic next to the obscure impression of a small rectangular seal. In margins, occasional notes in English, seemingly written by Price. Penultimate folio, verso, top: David Price (1805) Earlier than most of the MSS listed by Storey. Translation of Qazwini's Arabic work on the Marvels of Creation. The manuscript is of luxurious quality. An illuminated title-page is almost entirely obscured. A double-page miniature preceding the text has illuminated borders. Headings and quotations in gold outlined with black, or in red. Colophon similarly in gold. Ruled margins in black and gold. 148 miniatures in Commercial Turkman style, stated in the colophon to be the work of 'Abd al-Karim. See Robinson's catalogue, pp. 15-23, and the references given there.

listBibl.bibl: Price's bequest is noted in the Journal for 1836, pp. xii-xiv (an obituary notice p. lx).

handNote.persName: Muhammad b. Muhammad, known as Baqqal

bindingDesc.p: Black half-morocco binding, bound from the Carnegie U.K. Trust Grant 1929.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org

list.item: Islamic cosmology. The wonders of creation.
